skill.name: snapdom
skill.description: snapDOM is a fast, accurate DOM-to-image capture tool that converts HTML elements into scalable SVG images. Use for capturing HTML elements, converting DOM to images (SVG, PNG, JPG, WebP), preserving styles, fonts, and pseudo-elements.

security_audit.summary: This skill consists entirely of markdown documentation files describing a browser-based JavaScript library. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own documentation files were detected. The skill is purely informational.

content.value_statement: Need to capture styled DOM elements as images? SnapDOM provides fast, accurate DOM-to-image conversion with support for SVG, PNG, JPG, and WebP formats while preserving fonts, pseudo-elements, and CSS effects.
actual_capabilities: Convert HTML elements to SVG, PNG, JPG, or WebP images
Preserve CSS styles, fonts, and pseudo-elements (::before, ::after)
Handle CORS-blocked resources using proxy fallback
Support custom dimensions, scale, and quality settings
Export with embedded fonts and icon fonts
limitations: Browser-only library; requires browser environment to function
Same-origin policy restrictions apply without proxy
Cannot capture elements from external cross-origin frames without CORS
Does not support server-side rendering or Node.js environments

best_practices: Use scale parameter instead of width/height for better performance on high-resolution captures
Enable embedFonts: true to ensure custom fonts render correctly in exported images
Set useProxy: true when capturing elements with images from external domains to avoid CORS issues
anti_patterns: Avoid capturing extremely large page sections; split into smaller chunks for better performance
Do not forget to wait for fonts to fully load before capturing elements with custom typography
Avoid setting quality below 0.9 for PNG/JPG exports as it causes visible compression artifacts

faq.question: What formats does SnapDOM support?
faq.answer: SnapDOM supports SVG (vector), PNG, JPG, WebP (raster), Canvas, and Blob exports. SVG is best for scalable graphics while PNG/JPG work for photos.

faq.question: Can I use SnapDOM in Node.js?
faq.answer: No, SnapDOM is a browser-only library that requires DOM APIs. For server-side rendering, consider puppeteer or similar headless browser solutions.

faq.question: How does SnapDOM compare to html2canvas?
faq.answer: SnapDOM is 10-40x faster than html2canvas on complex elements (1.6ms vs 68ms for small elements) while supporting more CSS features like pseudo-elements.

faq.question: What happens to cross-origin images?
faq.answer: Cross-origin images are blocked by browser security. Enable useProxy: true to route requests through a CORS proxy, or ensure all assets are same-origin.

faq.question: Does SnapDOM preserve CSS transforms and shadows?
faq.answer: Yes, SnapDOM preserves CSS transforms, shadows, and pseudo-elements. Use straighten: true to remove transforms if needed for cleaner output.

faq.question: What browsers are supported?
faq.answer: Chrome/Edge 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+, and mobile browsers (iOS Safari 14+, Chrome Mobile). Older browsers may have limited support.
